text.text: Step 1. Kickoff meeting to review and selected indicators that are relevant to your community
The core team will review and select built, natural, and social environment indicators information.
Why do this:
It will help the core team organize indicators information and assign roles to core team for gathering data.
How to do this:
Download detailed instructions
1. Review the indicators for each system and topic in the indicators workbook
. Print out or share the workbook with your core team.
2. Core team holds kickoff meeting to discuss objectives and select indicators from workbook

to use to assess how resilient and equitable the community's built, natural, and social support systems are. Review the list of recommended indicators for each system and topic. Select the indicators that are most relevant. Refer to your resilience goals from Ch.1 if you're having difficulty deciding.
3. Assign responsibilities among your core team for collecting data and information for each indicator.
Establish a date for gathering this information, allowing enough time for any data preparation ahead of the indicators workshop.
4. Optional!
If there is anything you want to know that is not represented by the recommended indicators, feel free to add indicators. If you identify critical gaps, please note in the
Data Parking Lot
to consider addressing in the future.
Thing's you'll need:
2-hour kickoff meeting
- Indicators workbook
- Data parking lot (optional) [
This output:
- Indicators workbook with selected indicators marked
- List of who's responsible for gathering data for each selected indicator
